metadata.title: CVE-2021-3978 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
When copying files with rsync, octorpki uses the "-a" flag 0, which forcesrsync to copy binaries with the suid bit set as root. Since the providedservice definition defaults to root (https://github.com/cloudflare/cfrpki/blob/master/package/octorpki.service )this could allow for a vector, when combined with another vulnerabilitythat causes octorpki to process a malicious TAL file, for a local privilegeescalation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3978` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

octorpki - 1.4.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cfrpki package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.2-1').
